tenses.description: Used to describe actions happening now, general truths, or habitual actions. This is the most commonly used tense in German.
Used primarily in written German and formal speech to describe completed actions in the past. Also used in storytelling and narratives.
Used to express future actions, predictions, or intentions. Often used with time expressions like 'morgen' (tomorrow) or 'nächste Woche' (next week).
Used to express actions that will be completed by a certain point in the future. Often used with time expressions like 'bis morgen' (by tomorrow) or to make assumptions about past events.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Bis nächste Woche werde ich dort gewesen sein
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: By next week, I will have been there

conjugations.exampleSentence: Du wirst sicher sehr müde gewesen sein nach der langen Reise
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will surely have been very tired after the long journey

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sie wird wahrscheinlich zu Hause gewesen sein, als ich anrief
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She will probably have been at home when I called

conjugations.exampleSentence: In zwei Jahren werden wir verheiratet gewesen sein
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: In two years, we will have been married

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ihr werdet mit der Arbeit fertig gewesen sein, bevor der Chef kommt
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will have been finished with the work before the boss arrives

conjugations.exampleSentence: Bis Ende des Monats werden sie in drei Ländern gewesen sein
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: By the end of the month, they will have been to three countries

tenses.description: Used to express completed actions in the past that have a connection to the present. This is the most common past tense in spoken German.
Used to express actions that were completed before another past action. Often used in storytelling to establish a sequence of past events.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Als ich ankam, war ich schon einmal dort gewesen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: When I arrived, I had already been there before

conjugations.exampleSentence: Du warst vor der Prüfung sehr nervös gewesen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had been very nervous before the exam

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sie war lange Zeit Lehrerin gewesen, bevor sie Direktorin wurde
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She had been a teacher for a long time before she became principal

conjugations.exampleSentence: Wir waren im Museum gewesen, bevor wir ins Café gingen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had been to the museum before we went to the café

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ihr wart die ganze Nacht wach gewesen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had been awake all night

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sie waren gute Freunde gewesen, bis der Streit sie trennte
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had been good friends until the argument separated them

tenses.description: Used primarily in indirect speech and formal writing to report what someone else has said. Also used in certain fixed expressions and formal contexts.
Used to express hypothetical situations, polite requests, or actions that would happen under certain conditions. Often used with 'wenn' (if) clauses.
Used to give commands, orders, or instructions. Only exists for the second person (du, ihr) and formal address (Sie). The subject pronoun is usually omitted.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Please be on time for the meeting!

conjugations.exampleSentence: Seid vorsichtig, wenn ihr über die Straße geht!
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Be careful when you cross the street!

conjugations.exampleSentence: Seien Sie so freundlich und helfen Sie mir!
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Be so kind and help me!

tenses.description: Used to describe actions happening now, general truths, or habitual actions. This is the most commonly used tense in German.
Used primarily in written German and formal speech to describe completed actions in the past. Also used in storytelling and narratives.
Used to express future actions, predictions, or intentions. Often used with time expressions like 'morgen' (tomorrow) or 'nächste Woche' (next week).
Used to express actions that will be completed by a certain point in the future. Often used with time expressions like 'bis morgen' (by tomorrow) or to make assumptions about past events.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Bis morgen werde ich die Antwort gehabt haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: By tomorrow, I will have had the answer

conjugations.exampleSentence: Du wirst sicher einen anstrengenden Tag gehabt haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will surely have had an exhausting day

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er wird wahrscheinlich keine Zeit gehabt haben, dich anzurufen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He will probably not have had time to call you

conjugations.exampleSentence: Bis Ende des Jahres werden wir genug Geld für die Reise gehabt haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: By the end of the year, we will have had enough money for the trip

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ihr werdet bestimmt viel Spaß auf der Party gehabt haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will certainly have had a lot of fun at the party

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sie werden bis dahin drei Meetings gehabt haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They will have had three meetings by then

tenses.description: Used to express completed actions in the past that have a connection to the present. This is the most common past tense in spoken German.
Used to express actions that were completed before another past action. Often used in storytelling to establish a sequence of past events.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ich hatte vor dem Unfall noch nie Probleme mit dem Auto gehabt
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had never had problems with the car before the accident

conjugations.exampleSentence: Du hattest großes Glück gehabt, dass nichts Schlimmes passiert war
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had been very lucky that nothing bad had happened

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sie hatte schon drei Katzen gehabt, bevor sie den Hund bekam
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She had already had three cats before she got the dog

conjugations.exampleSentence: Wir hatten keine Ahnung gehabt, was uns erwartete
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had had no idea what was waiting for us

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ihr hattet genug Zeit gehabt, um alles vorzubereiten
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had had enough time to prepare everything

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sie hatten lange Zweifel gehabt, bevor sie die Entscheidung trafen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had had doubts for a long time before they made the decision

tenses.description: Used primarily in indirect speech and formal writing to report what someone else has said. Also used in certain fixed expressions and formal contexts.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er sagt, sie haben eine Party
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He says they have a party

tenses.description: Used to express hypothetical situations, polite requests, or actions that would happen under certain conditions. Often used with 'wenn' (if) clauses.
Used to give commands, orders, or instructions. Only exists for the second person (du, ihr) and formal address (Sie). The subject pronoun is usually omitted.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Hab keine Angst vor der Herausforderung!
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Don't be afraid of the challenge!

conjugations.exampleSentence: Haben Sie bitte etwas Geduld mit uns!
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Please have some patience with us!

tenses.description: Used to describe actions happening now, general truths, or habitual actions. This is the most commonly used tense in German.
Used primarily in written German and formal speech to describe completed actions in the past. Also used in storytelling and narratives.
Used to express future actions, predictions, or intentions. Often used with time expressions like 'morgen' (tomorrow) or 'nächste Woche' (next week).

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ich werde morgen zur Schule gehen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I will go to school tomorrow
She will go to the cinema
We will go for a walk
They will go to the theater

tenses.description: Used to express actions that will be completed by a certain point in the future. Often used with time expressions like 'bis morgen' (by tomorrow) or to make assumptions about past events.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Bis morgen werde ich zur Schule gegangen sein
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: By tomorrow, I will have gone to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Du wirst sicher nach Hause gegangen sein
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will surely have gone home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sie wird wahrscheinlich ins Kino gegangen sein
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She will probably have gone to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: Bis dahin werden wir spazieren gegangen sein
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: By then, we will have gone for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sie werden ins Theater gegangen sein
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They will have gone to the theater

tenses.description: Used to express completed actions in the past that have a connection to the present. This is the most common past tense in spoken German.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She has gone to the cinema
We have gone for a walk
They have gone to the theater

tenses.description: Used to express actions that were completed before another past action. Often used in storytelling to establish a sequence of past events.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Als ich ankam, war ich schon zur Schule gegangen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: When I arrived, I had already gone to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Du warst nach Hause gegangen, bevor ich kam
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had gone home before I came

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sie war ins Kino gegangen, als wir anriefen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She had gone to the cinema when we called

conjugations.exampleSentence: Wir waren spazieren gegangen, bevor es regnete
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had gone for a walk before it rained

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ihr wart einkaufen gegangen, als der Sturm begann
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had gone shopping when the storm began

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sie waren ins Theater gegangen, bevor wir kamen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had gone to the theater before we came

tenses.description: Used primarily in indirect speech and formal writing to report what someone else has said. Also used in certain fixed expressions and formal contexts.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er sagt, er gehe zur Schule
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He says he goes to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er sagt, du gehest nach Hause
Er sagt, sie gehe ins Kino
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He says she goes to the cinema
He says we go for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er sagt, sie gehen ins Theater
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He says they go to the theater

tenses.description: Used to express hypothetical situations, polite requests, or actions that would happen under certain conditions. Often used with 'wenn' (if) clauses.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I would gladly go to school
She would go to the cinema
We would go for a walk
They would go to the theater

Used to describe actions happening now, general truths, or habitual actions. This is the most commonly used tense in German.

Used to express actions that will be completed by a certain point in the future. Often used with time expressions like 'bis morgen' (by tomorrow) or to make assumptions about past events.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Bis morgen werde ich die Hausaufgaben gemacht haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: By tomorrow, I will have done the homework

conjugations.exampleSentence: Du wirst sicher den Kuchen gemacht haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will surely have made the cake

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er wird wahrscheinlich Sport gemacht haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He will probably have done sports

conjugations.exampleSentence: Wir werden die Musik gemacht haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We will have made the music

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ihr werdet den Fehler gemacht haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will have made the mistake

tenses.description: Used to express completed actions in the past that have a connection to the present. This is the most common past tense in spoken German.
Used to express actions that were completed before another past action. Often used in storytelling to establish a sequence of past events.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ich hatte die Hausaufgaben gemacht, bevor ich spielte
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had done the homework before I played

conjugations.exampleSentence: Du hattest den Kuchen gemacht, bevor ich kam
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had made the cake before I came

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er hatte Sport gemacht, bevor er aß
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He had done sports before he ate

conjugations.exampleSentence: Wir hatten Musik gemacht, bevor es regnete
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had made music before it rained

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ihr hattet den Fehler gemacht, bevor ihr es bemerktet
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had made the mistake before you noticed it

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sie hatten Fortschritte gemacht, bevor sie aufhörten
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had made progress before they stopped

tenses.description: Used primarily in indirect speech and formal writing to report what someone else has said. Also used in certain fixed expressions and formal contexts.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er sagt, du machest einen Kuchen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He says you make a cake

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er sagt, ihr machet einen Fehler
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He says you make a mistake

tenses.description: Used to express actions that will be completed by a certain point in the future. Often used with time expressions like 'bis morgen' (by tomorrow) or to make assumptions about past events.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Bis morgen werde ich Deutsch sprechen gekonnt haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: By tomorrow, I will have been able to speak German

conjugations.exampleSentence: Du wirst sicher gut singen gekonnt haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will surely have been able to sing well

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er wird wahrscheinlich schwimmen gekonnt haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He will probably have been able to swim
We will have been able to dance
You will have been able to cook
They will have been able to help

tenses.description: Used to express completed actions in the past that have a connection to the present. This is the most common past tense in spoken German.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I have been able to speak German
You have been able to sing well
He has been able to swim
We have been able to dance
You have been able to cook
They have been able to help

tenses.description: Used to express actions that were completed before another past action. Often used in storytelling to establish a sequence of past events.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ich hatte Deutsch sprechen gekonnt, bevor ich nach Deutschland ging
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had been able to speak German before I went to Germany

conjugations.exampleSentence: Du hattest gut singen gekonnt, bevor du aufhörte
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had been able to sing well before you stopped

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er hatte schwimmen gekonnt, bevor er verletzt wurde
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He had been able to swim before he got injured

conjugations.exampleSentence: Wir hatten tanzen gekonnt, bevor wir müde wurden
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had been able to dance before we got tired

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ihr hattet kochen gekonnt, bevor ihr umzogt
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had been able to cook before you moved

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sie hatten helfen gekonnt, bevor sie gingen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had been able to help before they left

tenses.description: Used primarily in indirect speech and formal writing to report what someone else has said. Also used in certain fixed expressions and formal contexts.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er sagt, er könne Deutsch sprechen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He says he can speak German

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er sagt, du könnest gut singen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He says you can sing well

tenses.description: Used to express hypothetical situations, polite requests, or actions that would happen under certain conditions. Often used with 'wenn' (if) clauses.
Used to give commands, orders, or instructions. Only exists for the second person (du, ihr) and formal address (Sie). The subject pronoun is usually omitted.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You always say the right thing

tenses.description: Used primarily in written German and formal speech to describe completed actions in the past. Also used in storytelling and narratives.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You always told the right thing

tenses.description: Used to express future actions, predictions, or intentions. Often used with time expressions like 'morgen' (tomorrow) or 'nächste Woche' (next week).

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will say the right thing

tenses.description: Used to express actions that will be completed by a certain point in the future. Often used with time expressions like 'bis morgen' (by tomorrow) or to make assumptions about past events.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Bis morgen werde ich die Wahrheit gesagt haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: By tomorrow, I will have told the truth

conjugations.exampleSentence: Du wirst sicher das Richtige gesagt haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will surely have said the right thing

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er wird wahrscheinlich hallo gesagt haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He will probably have said hello
We will have said thank you

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sie werden auf Wiedersehen gesagt haben

tenses.description: Used to express completed actions in the past that have a connection to the present. This is the most common past tense in spoken German.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You have said the right thing

tenses.description: Used to express actions that were completed before another past action. Often used in storytelling to establish a sequence of past events.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ich hatte die Wahrheit gesagt, bevor er kam
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had told the truth before he came

conjugations.exampleSentence: Du hattest das Richtige gesagt, bevor ich antwortete
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had said the right thing before I answered

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er hatte hallo gesagt, bevor er ging
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He had said hello before he left

conjugations.exampleSentence: Wir hatten danke gesagt, bevor wir gingen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had said thank you before we left

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ihr hattet bitte gesagt, bevor ihr aufhörtet
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had said please before you stopped

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sie hatten auf Wiedersehen gesagt, bevor sie gingen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had said goodbye before they left

tenses.description: Used primarily in indirect speech and formal writing to report what someone else has said. Also used in certain fixed expressions and formal contexts.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er sagt, er sage die Wahrheit
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He says he tells the truth

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er sagt, du sagest das Richtige
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He says you tell the right thing
He says we say thank you

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er sagt, sie sagen auf Wiedersehen

tenses.description: Used to express hypothetical situations, polite requests, or actions that would happen under certain conditions. Often used with 'wenn' (if) clauses.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I would gladly tell the truth

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er wird wahrscheinlich den Weg gewusst haben

tenses.description: Used to express completed actions in the past that have a connection to the present. This is the most common past tense in spoken German.
Used to express actions that were completed before another past action. Often used in storytelling to establish a sequence of past events.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ich hatte die Antwort gewusst, bevor ich sie vergaß
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had known the answer before I forgot it

conjugations.exampleSentence: Du hattest viel gewusst, bevor du es verlorst
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had known a lot before you lost it

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er hatte den Weg gewusst, bevor er sich verirrte
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He had known the way before he got lost

conjugations.exampleSentence: Wir hatten Bescheid gewusst, bevor wir es vergaßen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had known about it before we forgot it

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ihr hattet es gewusst, bevor ihr es verlorst
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had known it before you lost it

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sie hatten alles gewusst, bevor sie es vergaßen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had known everything before they forgot it

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er sagt, sie wisse den Weg
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He says she knows the way

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ich war Arzt geworden, bevor ich nach Deutschland ging
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had become a doctor before I went to Germany

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had become big before you went to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er war alt geworden, bevor er starb
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He had become old before he died

conjugations.exampleSentence: Wir waren Freunde geworden, bevor wir uns trennten
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had become friends before we separated

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ihr wart müde geworden, bevor ihr schliefet
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had become tired before you slept

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sie waren glücklich geworden, bevor sie starben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had become happy before they died

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He says he becomes a doctor

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ich war nach Hause gekommen, bevor er anrief
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had come home before he called

conjugations.exampleSentence: Du warst zu spät gekommen, bevor die Veranstaltung begann
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had come too late before the event began

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er war gestern gekommen, bevor wir gingen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He had come yesterday before we left

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had come together before it rained

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ihr wart mit gekommen, bevor ihr gingt
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had come along before you left

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had come today before they left

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: By tomorrow, I will have seen the movie

conjugations.exampleSentence: Du wirst sicher gut ausgesehen haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will surely have looked good

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He will probably have watched TV

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We will have seen each other tomorrow

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ihr werdet das Problem gesehen haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will have seen the problem

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sie werden die Lösung gesehen haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They will have seen the solution

tenses.description: Used to express completed actions in the past that have a connection to the present. This is the most common past tense in spoken German.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We have seen each other yesterday

tenses.description: Used to express actions that were completed before another past action. Often used in storytelling to establish a sequence of past events.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ich hatte den Film gesehen, bevor er anrief
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had seen the movie before he called

conjugations.exampleSentence: Du hattest gut ausgesehen, bevor du krank wurdest
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had looked good before you got sick

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er hatte fern gesehen, bevor er schlief
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He had watched TV before he slept

conjugations.exampleSentence: Wir hatten uns gesehen, bevor wir gingen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had seen each other before we left

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ihr hattet das Problem gesehen, bevor ihr es löstet
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had seen the problem before you solved it

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sie hatten die Lösung gesehen, bevor sie handelten
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had seen the solution before they acted

tenses.description: Used primarily in indirect speech and formal writing to report what someone else has said. Also used in certain fixed expressions and formal contexts.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er sagt, er sehe einen Film
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He says he sees a movie

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er sagt, du sehest gut aus
Er sagt, wir sehen uns morgen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He says we see each other tomorrow

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er sagt, ihr sehet das Problem
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He says you see the problem

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er sagt, sie sehen die Lösung
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He says they see the solution

tenses.description: Used to express hypothetical situations, polite requests, or actions that would happen under certain conditions. Often used with 'wenn' (if) clauses.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I would gladly see a movie
We would see each other tomorrow

tenses.description: Used to give commands, orders, or instructions. Only exists for the second person (du, ihr) and formal address (Sie). The subject pronoun is usually omitted.
Used to describe actions happening now, general truths, or habitual actions. This is the most commonly used tense in German.
Used primarily in written German and formal speech to describe completed actions in the past. Also used in storytelling and narratives.
Used to express future actions, predictions, or intentions. Often used with time expressions like 'morgen' (tomorrow) or 'nächste Woche' (next week).

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ich werde dir ein Geschenk geben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I will give you a gift

tenses.description: Used to express actions that will be completed by a certain point in the future. Often used with time expressions like 'bis morgen' (by tomorrow) or to make assumptions about past events.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Bis morgen werde ich dir ein Geschenk gegeben haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: By tomorrow, I will have given you a gift

conjugations.exampleSentence: Du wirst sicher mir Hoffnung gegeben haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will surely have given me hope

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er wird wahrscheinlich sein Bestes gegeben haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He will probably have given his best
We will not have given up

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ihr werdet euch Mühe gegeben haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will have made an effort

tenses.description: Used to express completed actions in the past that have a connection to the present. This is the most common past tense in spoken German.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ich habe dir ein Geschenk gegeben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I have given you a gift

tenses.description: Used to express actions that were completed before another past action. Often used in storytelling to establish a sequence of past events.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ich hatte dir ein Geschenk gegeben, bevor du kamst
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had given you a gift before you came

conjugations.exampleSentence: Du hattest mir Hoffnung gegeben, bevor ich ging
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had given me hope before I left

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er hatte sein Bestes gegeben, bevor er aufhörte
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He had given his best before he stopped

conjugations.exampleSentence: Wir hatten nicht aufgegeben, bevor wir gewannen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had not given up before we won

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ihr hattet euch Mühe gegeben, bevor ihr aufhörtet
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had made an effort before you stopped

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sie hatten alles gegeben, bevor sie gingen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had given everything before they left

tenses.description: Used primarily in indirect speech and formal writing to report what someone else has said. Also used in certain fixed expressions and formal contexts.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er sagt, er gebe dir ein Geschenk
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He says he gives you a gift

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er sagt, du gebest mir Hoffnung
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He says you give me hope

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er sagt, sie gebe ihr Bestes
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He says she gives her best

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er sagt, wir geben nicht auf
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He says we don't give up

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er sagt, ihr gebet euch Mühe
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He says you make an effort

tenses.description: Used to express hypothetical situations, polite requests, or actions that would happen under certain conditions. Often used with 'wenn' (if) clauses.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ich gäbe dir gerne ein Geschenk
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I would gladly give you a gift

tenses.description: Used to give commands, orders, or instructions. Only exists for the second person (du, ihr) and formal address (Sie). The subject pronoun is usually omitted.
Used to describe actions happening now, general truths, or habitual actions. This is the most commonly used tense in German.
Used primarily in written German and formal speech to describe completed actions in the past. Also used in storytelling and narratives.
Used to express future actions, predictions, or intentions. Often used with time expressions like 'morgen' (tomorrow) or 'nächste Woche' (next week).
Used to express actions that will be completed by a certain point in the future. Often used with time expressions like 'bis morgen' (by tomorrow) or to make assumptions about past events.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Bis morgen werde ich lernen gewollt haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: By tomorrow, I will have wanted to learn

conjugations.exampleSentence: Du wirst sicher spielen gewollt haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will surely have wanted to play

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er wird wahrscheinlich arbeiten gewollt haben
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He will probably have wanted to work
We will have wanted to travel
You will have wanted to eat
They will have wanted to help

tenses.description: Used to express completed actions in the past that have a connection to the present. This is the most common past tense in spoken German.
Used to express actions that were completed before another past action. Often used in storytelling to establish a sequence of past events.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ich hatte lernen gewollt, bevor ich aufhörte
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had wanted to learn before I stopped

conjugations.exampleSentence: Du hattest spielen gewollt, bevor du gingst
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had wanted to play before you left

conjugations.exampleSentence: Er hatte arbeiten gewollt, bevor er krank wurde
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He had wanted to work before he got sick

conjugations.exampleSentence: Wir hatten reisen gewollt, bevor wir aufhörten
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had wanted to travel before we stopped

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ihr hattet essen gewollt, bevor ihr gingt
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had wanted to eat before you left

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sie hatten helfen gewollt, bevor sie gingen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had wanted to help before they left

tenses.description: Used primarily in indirect speech and formal writing to report what someone else has said. Also used in certain fixed expressions and formal contexts.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He says he wants to learn
He says you want to play
He says she wants to work
He says we want to travel
He says you want to eat
He says they want to help

tenses.description: Used to express hypothetical situations, polite requests, or actions that would happen under certain conditions. Often used with 'wenn' (if) clauses.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I would gladly want to learn

tenses.description: Used to give commands, orders, or instructions. Only exists for the second person (du, ihr) and formal address (Sie). The subject pronoun is usually omitted.
